channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google Maps just got a fresh injection of AI features—here’s what you can do now
item.description: “We are entering a new era of maps,” Google Maps general manager Miriam Daniel said.

item.title: Stocks open lower as Meta and Microsoft weigh on broader market — live coverage
Election warning: Zelle CEO says elderly Americans and their families need to be on ‘heightened state of alert’ against scams
item.description: With reports of elderly victims of political scammers on the rise, the payment giant that transacted $481 million in he first half of 2024, says famil...

item.title: Ikea pledges €6 million to former prisoners of communist East Germany who were forced to build flat-pack furniture during the Cold War
item.description: “We deeply regret that this happened,” said Walter Kadnar, CEO of Ikea Germany.

item.title: History suggests the stock market is rarely spooked on Halloween
Two years ago, world leaders established a global Pandemic Fund. Now its co-chairs are warning it needs at least $2 billion by June
item.description: Due to the high demand in many countries, the Pandemic Fund will exhaust most of its funds by next June.

item.title: Peloton shares soar as Apple alum is tapped as CEO
COVID-19 is no longer the world’s leading infectious disease killer
item.description: A longtime leading killer retakes the lead.

item.title: U.S. initial unemployment claims retreat to lowest level since May
Biggest nut left for Fed to crack? Core inflation.
